intro: Harmsiodoxa blennodioides, commonly known as the African daisy, is a perennial herbaceous plant native to southern Africa. It is characterized by its dense, grass-like foliage and produces clusters of small, daisy-like yellow flowers. The plant typically grows in open, sunny habitats such as grasslands and rocky soils. It has a fibrous root system and is adapted to dry conditions, making it drought-tolerant. Its flowers attract pollinators like bees and butterflies, contributing to its ecological significance.
